00028 #include <signal.h>   /* for kill() */
00029 #include <sys/wait.h> /* for waitpid() */
00030 #include <unistd.h>   /* for fork() */
00031 #include <errno.h>    /* for errno() */
00032 #include <time.h>     /* for time() */
00033 #include <string.h>   /* for strerror() */
00034 #include <stdlib.h>   /* for exit() */
00035 
00036 #include <setjmp.h>
00037 #include "processes.h"
00038 #include "sighand.h"
00039 #include "log.h"
00040 
00041 
00042 static int process_son = 0;
00043 
00044 static void
00045 pr_sigterm (int sig)
00046 {
00047   _exit (0);
00048 }
00049 
00050 
00051 int
00052 terminate_process (pid_t pid)
00053 {
00054   int ret;
00055 
00056   if (pid <= 0)
00057     return 0;
00058 
00059   ret = kill (pid, SIGTERM);
00060 
00061   if (ret == 0)
00062     {
00063       usleep (1000);
00064       if (waitpid (pid, NULL, WNOHANG) >= 0)
00065         kill (pid, SIGKILL);
00066     }
00067   return -1;
00068 }
00069 
00070 
00074 pid_t
00075 create_process (process_func_t function, void *argument)
00076 {
00077   int pid;
00078 
00079   pid = fork ();
00080 
00081   if (pid == 0)
00082     {
00083       process_son = 0;
00084       openvas_signal (SIGHUP, SIG_IGN);
00085       openvas_signal (SIGTERM, pr_sigterm);
00086       openvas_signal (SIGINT, pr_sigterm);
00087       openvas_signal (SIGPIPE, SIG_IGN);
00088       openvas_signal (SIGUSR1, SIG_IGN);
00089       openvas_signal (SIGUSR2, SIG_IGN);
00090       openvas_signal (SIGCHLD, sighand_chld);
00091       openvas_signal (SIGSEGV, sighand_segv);   /* Comment this line out to dump a core and debug openvassd */
00092       srand48 (getpid () + getppid () + (long) time (NULL));    /* RATS: ignore */
00093       (*function) (argument);
00094       exit (0);
00095     }
00096   if (pid < 0)
00097     log_write ("Error : could not fork ! Error : %s\n", strerror (errno));
00098   process_son = pid;
00099   return pid;
00100 }
